required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Denosumab and Screw Fixation for Osteoporotic Compression Fracture
clinical_study.official_title: Attending Doctor of Shenzhen People's Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of bone mineral density and function at 1 year after screw internal fixation of osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures with desuzumab: a parallel double-blind randomized controlled clinical trial

detailed_description.textblock: Conduct a single-center, double-blind, randomized controlled clinical trial according to clinical Trial Reporting Standards (CONSORT). Bone mineral density and function were compared 1 year after screw internal fixation of osteoporotic vertebral compression fracture (OVCF) with desomumab versus placebo in Shenzhen People's Hospital from September, 2021 to September, 2022. The study was approved by Shenzhen People's Hospital and informed consent was signed

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: osteocalcin in the N terminal molecular fragment
C-terminal cross-linked type 1 collagen terminal peptide
DEXA for lumber spine bone mineral density
DEXA for hip bone mineral density
Bone marrow edema and adjacent intervertebral disc were detected by MRI
The NRS is a segmented numerical version of the VAS in which a respondent selects a whole number (0- 10) that best reflects the intensity of the pain

VRSs use categories to differentiate pain intensity. There is a wide variability of terms used to describe each category and the rating may be divided into four (0 -3) or six (0 -5) categories. Patients score their pain intensity from absent (0) to severe (3) or from none (0) to very severe (5)

secondary_outcome.description: The RDQ is a health status measure designed to be completed by patients to assess physical disability due to low back pain.
Quality of Life Questionnaire of the European Foundation for Osteoporosis (QUALEFFO) was developed in 1997 to evaluate HRQoL for patients with osteoporosis

secondary_outcome.measure: EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D): an instrument for measuring quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D descriptive system is a preference-based HRQL measure with one question for each of the five dimensions that include mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression.

clinical_study.condition: Denosumab and Screw Internal Fixation of Osteoporotic Vertebral Compression Fracture

arm_group.description: Desuzumab 60 mg subcutaneously /6 months, twice a year
Placebo subcutaneous injection /6 months, twice a year

intervention.description: denosumab subcutaneous injection /6 months, twice a year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:• Must be age between 40 and 90 years old
- X-ray diagnosis of 1-2 vertebral compression fractures
- DEXA test BMD T value was less than -1
- fracture history lasted within 6 weeks
- MRI showed bone marrow edema of injured segment
- lower back pain, local spines tenderness
Exclusion Criteria:
- • Must be able to have no posterior vertebral wall fracture
- Must be able to have no patients with intervertebral fissure
- Must be able to have no infection
- Must be able to have no malignancy
- Must be able to have no neurological dysfunction
- Must be able to have no previous use of anti-osteoporosis drugs within 6 weeks
- Must be able to have no inability to perform magnetic resonance imaging
- Must be able to have no prior back surgery
- Must be able to have no other established contraindications for elective surgery
